column1: Bantul (Indonesian pronunciation: [ˈbantʊl]) is a regency located in the Yogyakarta Special Region
column2: Indonesia. It is located on the island of Java. The regency's population was 911
column5: 568 according to the latest (January 2014) official estimate. Like many regencies on the island of Java
column6: it is densely populated with roughly 1
column8: although this is largely because the north of the regency partly surrounds the city of Yogyakarta and contains many suburban communities.

column1: The regency is bordered by the city of Yogyakarta and Sleman regency to the north
column2: the regency of Kulon Progo to the west
column3: the Gunung Kidul Regency to the east and the Indian Ocean to the south. The town of Bantul is the administrative centre.

column1: The village Kemusuk in the Sedayu district in the regency is the birthplace of former Indonesian President
On 27 May 2006 an earthquake measuring 6.3 on the Richter scale struck near Java's southern coast causing widespread damage. Bantul Regency was the region most affected by the disaster. Around 4
column2: 100 residents of Bantul Regency were killed

column1: Bantul Regency has 2 locations of turtles nesting
column2: in Gua Cemara Beach and Pelangi Beach. Both have only more than 10 nests each in a year. Nesting period is in July and August.
